TextView.android:text: When counting numbers aloud, Irish uses the vocative form of numbers. They follow slightly different lenition in comparison to the regular vocative case, but is entirely regular and never changes.
Vocative numbers are found in all forms of life. They provide a measure of estimating a number of nouns in a collection, in games, and generally knowing spacial position.

The numbers in Irish differ from regular vocative case by not becomes lenited. Numbers after 19 do not take the particle 'a'. Numbers from 0 to 19 are seen as nouns and receive the particle as a result of this.
